titleStmt.title: Prosodic Patterns to be Encoded in Editions

publicationStmt.authority: DHARMA Project (ERC 809994): The Domestication of “Hindu” Asceticism and the Religious Making of South and Southeast Asia (2019–2025).

licence.p: This work is licenced under the Creative Commons Attribution 2.0 Unported Licence. To view a copy of the licence, visit https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/ or send a letter to Creative Commons, 444 Castro Street, Suite 900, Mountain View, California, 94041, USA.

abstract.p: List of all the prosodic patterns used in the epigraphic and manuscript-based editions produced by the DHARMA project.

revisionDesc.change: Inserted references from Zoetmulder, Sugriwa, and Candrakiraṇa text
Revised references from Zoetmulder up to 10 syllables (leaving out 8 syllables for now)
Some tidying and adding vipulā anuṣṭubh
Inserted altname prabodhitā under viyoginī and completed Zoetmulder reference
Adding references to Apte's appendix and some tidying
Adding bibl and seg @type="gana" and changing note for label
Creation of the file, adding some informations and minimal metadata

table.head: Prosodic notation in XML code (@type="xml") and conventional symbols (@type="prosody")

row.cell: two morae (one long or two short syllables)
boundary of odd and even quarter

item.name: kusumitagandha
kusumitajanma
item.note: The name of this meter in CK is "kusumitagandha", while in Vr̥t is "kusumitajanma".

bibl.note: Zoetmulder in Kalangwan (p. 451) incorrectly describes the pattern meter as ⏑⏑⏑|⏑⏓ (less one syllable).

item.name: śāpāntika1
item.note: The meter pattern of śāpāntika is slightly different in CK and Vr̥t. In CK, śāpāntika is presented as ––⏑|⏑⏑⏑|⏑⏓, while in Vr̥t ––⏑|–⏑⏑|⏑⏓.

item.name: śāpāntika2
item.note: The meter pattern of śāpāntika is slightly different in CK and Vr̥t. In CK, śāpāntika is presented as ––⏑|⏑⏑⏑|⏑⏓, while in Vr̥t ––⏑|–⏑⏑|⏑⏓.

item.name: vitana
item.note: In Vr̥t, the name of this meter is vitāna. The metric pattern is also slightly different in both CK and Vr̥t. In CK, vitana is presented as –⏑⏑|–⏑⏑|⏑⏓, while in Vr̥t vitāna has patterns as –⏑⏑|–⏑⏑|–⏓. But, Zoetmulder records vitānā's pattern as –⏑–|–⏑–|–⏓

item.name: anuṣṭubh
item.note: The second and third syllables of any quarter must not be both short in anuṣṭubh.

item.name: na-vipulā
item.note: This is a variation permitted in any odd line of an anuṣṭubh stanza. In encoding, this metre can only apply to lines, never to stanzas. The second and third syllables of any quarter must not be both short.

item.name: bha-vipulā
item.note: This is a variation permitted in any odd line of an anuṣṭubh stanza. In encoding, this metre can only apply to lines, never to stanzas.

item.name: ma-vipulā
item.note: This is a variation permitted in any odd line of an anuṣṭubh stanza. In encoding, this metre can only apply to lines, never to stanzas.

item.name: ra-vipulā
item.note: This is a variation permitted in any odd line of an anuṣṭubh stanza. In encoding, this metre can only apply to lines, never to stanzas. The second and third syllables of any quarter must not be both short.

item.name: triṣṭubh
item.note: There is no simple way to codify or summarise triṣṭubh because of the degree of variation permitted. See EGD Appendix B, "Vedic trimeter".

item.name: jagatī
item.note: There is no simple way to codify or summarise jagatī because of the degree of variation permitted. See EGD Appendix B, "Vedic trimeter".

bibl.note: Only mentioned by Apte as a variety of upajāti under Appendix A, I.A.11.3

item.name: madhyakṣāmā
haṁsaśyenī
kuṭila
kuvalayakusuma
item.note: The meter kuvalayakusuma in the Vr̥t has the 14 syllables whose the short-long patterns are identical with madhyakṣāmā in Sanskrit while the CK has the 15 syllables of kuvalayakusuma.

bibl.note: Zoetmulder gives the prosody erroneously as –⏑⏑|–⏑–|⏑⏑⏑|–⏑–|⏑⏑⏑|-⏑-|⏑⏑⏑|⏓ (bha-ra-na-ra-na-ra-na-ga). The 6th gaṇa is correctly -⏑- (ra) as shown in Apte's appendix, in Apte's source (Piṅgala's Chandaḥśāstra 7.26), and confirmed by actual Javanese examples.

item.label: abhikr̥ti
item.note: Apte refers to this class as atikr̥ti, not abhikr̥ti.

item.name: trimeter
item.note: Vedic trimeter consisting of loosely constrained 11- or 12-syllable lines that do not conform to the fixed patterns of triṣṭubh or jagatī.

list.head: The vaitālīya class: metres with a moraic part and a syllabo-quantitative cadence
The daṇḍaka class: metres involving many repetitions of a foot

item.name: daṇḍa
item.note: Any number of iterations of the foot –⏑⏑, followed by –⏑⏑–⏑–⏑⏓.

item.name: daṇḍaka
item.note: The sequence ⏑⏑⏑⏑⏑⏑ followed by any number of iterations of the foot –⏑–.

item.name: malāhati
malavati
item.note: Any number of iterations of the foot ⏑⏑–.
